snippet: Margaret Thatcher’s conservative prescriptions for her country’s economy have never found fertile soil on the Continent, not even amid a gloom at least as dark as that of ’70s Britain.
abstract: News analysis; Margaret Thatcher’s conservative prescriptions for her country’s economy, including sweeping privatization and deregulation, never found fertile soil on the Continent;  many Britons remember her as a dominant yet divisive figure whose pervasive influence on political thinking about the role of the state in free societies spread far beyond Britain’s shores.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: Margaret Thatcher’s conservative prescriptions for her country’s economy have never found fertile soil on the Continent, not even amid a gloom at least as dark as that of ’70s Britain.

headline.seo: Thatcher Policies Still Resisted by Europe
headline.main: Thatcher’s Fiscal Policies Are Still a Tough Sell for Europe
